group_1.textLeft: (...Is my pride doing the talking too...?)
(It's true that the moment I realized the haregi was gone,)
(I really regretted it.)
(If giving up on that haregi means going back to @how I was feeling before,)
(I better let the real me do the talking instead.)
(Time to be honest, and say what I really feel.)
The truth is, that blue haregi...
Ever since I first saw it,@I haven't been able to get it out of my head.
I had never been interested in that sort of thing @until now,
but for some reason, that haregi is different...
For some reason, just by looking at it...@I feel more confident in myself.
That's why I want to go to my first shrine visit@in that haregi, with my head held high...
But I'm not sure if it would really suit me...
In any case, it's been bugging me a lot.
In the end, I guess I wanna wear it so much I can't @take it...
So please!
Won't you please sell me that haregi?!
Huh?@I-is it really okay...?
I do, but...
I'm sorry, it's just that since I heard you choose your customers...

group_1.textRight: -- who want their kimonos@from the bottom of their hearts.
And you've already checked that box.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you so much...

group_1.textRight: No need to worry yourself so much.
As they say, "When winter comes, spring isn't far behind."

group_1.textLeft: Huh?@What does that mean?

group_1.textRight: It means that the greater the struggle,@the greater the happiness it earns you.
This has been bugging you for a while, hasn't it?
Then I'm sure, with the worrying behind you, and @this haregi in hand...
You're sure to find happiness ahead.

group_1.textLeft: ...Yeah!!
